title: UI/UX Design Principles
description: Explore the fundamentals of creating effective user interfaces

cards.question: What is the difference between UI and UX?
cards.answer: UI (User Interface) refers to the visual elements users interact with. UX (User Experience) encompasses the entire user journey and how they feel about the interaction.

cards.question: What is the principle of hierarchy in design?
cards.answer: Hierarchy in design is about organizing elements by importance, guiding users through content in a specific order using size, color, contrast, and spacing.

cards.question: What is white space in design?
cards.answer: White space (or negative space) is the empty area between design elements. It helps improve readability, focus attention, and create visual hierarchy.

cards.question: What is accessibility in design?
cards.answer: Accessibility in design ensures products can be used by people with disabilities. This includes considerations for color contrast, text size, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility.

cards.question: What is a design system?
cards.answer: A design system is a collection of reusable components, patterns, and guidelines that ensure consistency across products and help teams collaborate more efficiently.
